research investment woefully low]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/uTwWAfWJWUc/Mental-Health-research-investment-anxiety-depression-bi-polar</link><description><a src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/920457_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />BRITAIN is spending only £8 per affected person in researching the causes of mental health illness, compared with £178 currently spent on cancer, the UK’s only mental health research charity wanted last night.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/uTwWAfWJWUc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/920457/Mental-Health-research-investment-anxiety-depression-bi-polar#comments</comments><pubDate>Sun, deficiency: Seven symptoms you’re not getting enough - including hair loss]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/ZVyXa6Feuic/protein-deficiency-symptoms</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919054/protein-deficiency-symptoms"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919054_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />Protein is one of the most important nutrients, helping build muscle, skin, enzymes and hormones, so unsurprisingly a protein deficiency can have a big impact on body function. There are seven symptoms to look out for that could indicate that you need to increase your protein intake.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/ZVyXa6Feuic" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919054/protein-deficiency-symptoms#comments</comments><pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 09:00:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919054/protein-deficiency-symptoms</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919054/protein-deficiency-symptoms</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Low sex drive? You could boost your libido by following these simple tips]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/DJwohGLRqRc/sex-drive-libido-low-increase-how-to-stress-alcohol</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919934/sex-drive-libido-low-increase-how-to-stress-alcohol"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919934_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />SEX drive, or libido, is different in every person, and could be affected by stress, anxiety, and tiredness. You could boost your sex drive by following these tips.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/DJwohGLRqRc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919934/sex-drive-libido-low-increase-how-to-stress-alcohol#comments</comments><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 04:00:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919934/sex-drive-libido-low-increase-how-to-stress-alcohol</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919934/sex-drive-libido-low-increase-how-to-stress-alcohol</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Weight loss diet – FIVE tips to help you beat food and sugar cravings]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/Tdhtfqv9x4w/weight-loss-diet-plan-best-craving</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919915/weight-loss-diet-plan-best-craving"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919915_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />WEIGHT loss diet plans can be difficulty to stick to, and beating food cravings can be one of the most challenging parts of losing a few pounds. But, you could prevent unhealthy food and sugar desires by following these five tips.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/Tdhtfqv9x4w" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919915/weight-loss-diet-plan-best-craving#comments</comments><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 19:00:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919915/weight-loss-diet-plan-best-craving</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919915/weight-loss-diet-plan-best-craving</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[High blood pressure: Add these SEVEN foods to your diet to slash your BP]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/cfonfZf-7Hs/high-blood-pressure-symptoms-hypertension-lower-food-diet</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919845/high-blood-pressure-symptoms-hypertension-lower-food-diet"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919845_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />HIGH blood pressure symptoms are rarely noticeable unless the condition is extreme. You could lower your hypertension risk by adding these simple foods to your diet.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/cfonfZf-7Hs" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919845/high-blood-pressure-symptoms-hypertension-lower-food-diet#comments</comments><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 08:14:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919845/high-blood-pressure-symptoms-hypertension-lower-food-diet</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919845/high-blood-pressure-symptoms-hypertension-lower-food-diet</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Cold cure: These are UK parent's top tips and remedies]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/z8OeFip9vFo/cold-cure-UK-parents-tips-remedies-medicine-chicken-soup</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/920048/cold-cure-UK-parents-tips-remedies-medicine-chicken-soup"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/920048_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />THE COMMON cold is costing UK families almost a week’s-worth of sleep every year, a new study has found. New research by Vicks shows families with children aged under five estimate they lose 50 hours of sleep annually due to colds.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/z8OeFip9vFo" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/920048/cold-cure-UK-parents-tips-remedies-medicine-chicken-soup#comments</comments><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:07:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/920048/cold-cure-UK-parents-tips-remedies-medicine-chicken-soup</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/920048/cold-cure-UK-parents-tips-remedies-medicine-chicken-soup</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Prostate cancer - how to test for the disease and what to expect when you see a GP]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/wUgDPwrfU5Y/prostate-cancer-symptoms-uk-treatment-test-gp-nhs</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919807/prostate-cancer-symptoms-uk-treatment-test-gp-nhs"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919807_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />PROSTATE cancer symptoms include urinating more often than usual and feeling like your bladder isn’t ever entirely empty. You should always see a doctor if you’re showing signs of the cancer, but what should you expect, and how can you test for prostate cancer?<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/wUgDPwrfU5Y" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919807/prostate-cancer-symptoms-uk-treatment-test-gp-nhs#comments</comments><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 14:58:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919807/prostate-cancer-symptoms-uk-treatment-test-gp-nhs</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919807/prostate-cancer-symptoms-uk-treatment-test-gp-nhs</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Whooping cough: Could YOU benefit from getting the bacterial infection vaccine?]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/jV-XjiKLzCg/whooping-cough-vaccine-pertussis-pregnancy-treatment</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919774/whooping-cough-vaccine-pertussis-pregnancy-treatment"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919774_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />WHOOPING cough is a contagious bacterial infection that can cause vomiting and difficulty breathing. But, is there a vaccine available to protect against the coughing infection, and should pregnant women get vaccinated?<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/jV-XjiKLzCg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919774/whooping-cough-vaccine-pertussis-pregnancy-treatment#comments</comments><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919774/whooping-cough-vaccine-pertussis-pregnancy-treatment</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919774/whooping-cough-vaccine-pertussis-pregnancy-treatment</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Digestive problems? These 5p a day supplements could cure bloating]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/yguWIrNfgDQ/constipation-bloating-supplements-probiotics-digestion</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919728/constipation-bloating-supplements-probiotics-digestion"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919728_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />CONSTIPATION pain and bloating can make your stomach feel stretched and uncomfortable. But, taking these cheap probiotic supplements everyday could help to boost your immune system and help with digestion.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/yguWIrNfgDQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919728/constipation-bloating-supplements-probiotics-digestion#comments</comments><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 08:31:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919728/constipation-bloating-supplements-probiotics-digestion</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919728/constipation-bloating-supplements-probiotics-digestion</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title><![CDATA[Arthritis pain: Add this £1 fruit to your diet everyday to CURE joint stiffness]]></title><link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~3/5Fw6ZLKDshU/arthritis-pain-uk-symptoms-diet-cure-joint-pain</link><description><a href="https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919705/arthritis-pain-uk-symptoms-diet-cure-joint-pain"><img src="http://cdn.images.express.co.uk/img/dynamic/11/590x/919705_1.jpg"/></a><br /><br />ARTHRITIS pain affects about 10 million people in the UK. Adding more of this fruit to your diet could lower your risk of joint pain and inflammation.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/daily-express-life-and-style-health-news/~4/5Fw6ZLKDshU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><comments>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919705/arthritis-pain-uk-symptoms-diet-cure-joint-pain#comments</comments><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 07:31:00 +0000</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919705/arthritis-pain-uk-symptoms-diet-cure-joint-pain</guid><feedburner:origLink>https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/health/919705/arthritis-pain-uk-symptoms-diet-cure-joint-pain</feedburner:origLink></item></channel></rss>
